Name: AIX
File systems supported: JFS, JFS2, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, SMBFS, GPFS

Name: AmigaOS Classic
File systems supported: Proprietary (OFS, FFS, SFS, PFS), FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, many others via 3rd party drivers, such as SMBFS, etc.

Name: AmigaOS 4
File systems supported: Proprietary (OFS, FFS, SFS, PFS), JXFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, many others via 3rd party drivers, such as SMBFS, etc.

Name: Chrome OS
File systems supported: eCryptfs, NTFS, FAT, FAT16, FAT32, exFAT, ext2, ext3, ext4, HFS+, MTP (read and write), ISO9660 (read-only), UDF (read-only)

Name: DragonFly BSD
File systems supported: UFS1, MFS, ext2, FAT (16/32), HAMMER, ISO 9660

Name: eComStation
File systems supported: HPFS (default), FAT, JFS, UDF, FAT32, NTFS (read only)

Name: FreeBSD
Computer architectures supported: x86, x86-64, ARM, MIPS, PowerPC, others
File systems supported: UFS2, ZFS, ext2, ext3, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, others

Name: Genode
File systems supported: ext2, ext3, FAT32, ISO9660

Name: GhostBSD
File systems supported: UFS2, ext2, ext3, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, ReiserFS (read only), XFS (experimental), ZFS, others

Name: Linux
Computer architectures supported: x86, x86-64, ARM, PowerPC, SPARC, others
File systems supported: ext2, ext3, ext4, btrfs, ReiserFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, and others
Source lines of code: ~15 million (kernel)[22] lines of code for userland libraries and applications vary depending on the distribution

Name: Haiku
File systems supported: BFS (default), FAT, ISO 9660, ext3, NTFS

Name: HP-UX
File systems supported: VxFS, HFS, CDFS, EVFS, NFS, CIFS

Name: Inferno
Computer architectures supported: x86, PowerPC, SPARC, Alpha, MIPS, others
File systems supported: Styx/9P2000, kfs, FAT, ISO 9660
Kernel type: Monolithic with modules, user space file systems

Name: iOS
File systems supported: HFS+ (prior to version 10.3), APFS (since version 10.3), FTP{{cn|date=August 2018}}

Name: Classic Mac OS
File systems supported: HFS+, HFS, MFS (Mac OS 8.0 and before), AFP, ISO 9660, FAT(System 7 and later), UDF

Name: macOS
Computer architectures supported: PowerPC, x86, x86-64, (see also iOS for ARM)
File systems supported: HFS+ (default on hard drives, and on flash drives up to Sierra), APFS (default on flash drives in High Sierra), HFS, UFS, AFP, ISO 9660, FAT, UDF, NFS, SMBFS, NTFS (read only), FTP, WebDAV, ZFS (experimental)
Non-native APIs supported through subsys: Toolbox (only in versions up to Mac OS X 10.4, not supported on x86 architecture), Win16,[19] Win32[19]

Name: NetBSD
Computer architectures supported: x86, x86-64, ARM, MIPS, PowerPC, sparc64, others
File systems supported: UFS, UFS2, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, NFS, LFS, and others

Name: NetWare
File systems supported: NSS, NWFS, FAT, NFS, AFP, UDF, CIFS, ISO 9660
Update management: binary updates, ZENWorks for Servers, Red Carpet

Name: OpenBSD
Computer architectures supported: x86, x86-64, SPARC, 68k, Alpha, VAX, others
File systems supported: ffs, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, NFS, some others
Update management: by source or binary (packages via pkg_add)

Name: OpenVMS
File systems supported: Files-11 (ODS), ISO 9660, NFS, CIFS

Name: OS/2
File systems supported: HPFS, JFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS

Name: Plan 9
Computer architectures supported: x86, Alpha, MIPS, PowerPC, SPARC, others
File systems supported: fossil/venti, 9P2000, kfs, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660
Source lines of code: ~ 2.5 Million /sys/src (complete source of all supported architectures, kernels, commands and libraries)

Name: QNX
File systems supported: QNX4FS, QNX6, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, Joliet, NFS, CIFS, ETFS, UDF, HFS, HFS+, NTFS, others

Name: ReactOS
File systems supported: FAT, NTFS (read only)

Name: RISC OS
File systems supported: Acorn ADFS, Econet ANFS, FAT, ISO 9660, many others as loadable filesystems
Kernel type: Monolithic with modules. Cooperative multitasking with limited memory protection.[27]

Name: Solaris
File systems supported: UFS, ZFS, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, QFS, some others
Package management: SysV packages (pkgadd) Image Packaging System (pkg) (Solaris 11 and later)

Name: OpenSolaris
File systems supported: UFS, ZFS, ext2, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, QFS, some others
Source lines of code: grep total | awk '{ sum += $1 } END {print sum }' on [1] results in 18793105

Name: STOP 6, XTS-400
File systems supported: Proprietary
Update management: Binary updates via postal mail and proprietary tools

Name: Symbian
File systems supported: FAT

Name: TrueOS
File systems supported: UFS2, ext2, ext3, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, NFS, ReiserFS (read only), XFS (experimental) and others
Package management: Ports collection, packages, PBI Graphical Installers
Update management: by PBI updates, source, network binary update (freebsdupdate)

Name: Windows Server (NT family)
File systems supported: NTFS, FAT, ISO 9660, UDF
Kernel type: 3rd-party drivers support ext2, ext3, ReiserFS,[30] and HFS
column11: DOS API, Win16 (only in 32-bit versions), POSIX, .NET

Name: Windows (NT family)
File systems supported: NTFS, FAT exFAT ISO 9660, UDF
Kernel type: 3rd-party drivers support ext2, ext3, ReiserFS,[30] HFS+, FATX, and HFS (with third party driver)
column11: DOS API, Win16 (only in 32-bit versions), POSIX, .NET

Name: ZETA
File systems supported: BFS (default), FAT, ISO 9660, UDF, HFS, AFP, ext2, CIFS, NTFS (read only), ReiserFS (read only, up to v3.6)

Name: z/OS
File systems supported: VSAM, BDAM, QSAM, BPAM, HFS, zFS, etc.
Kernel type: Protected, multithreading, multitasking nucleus with programmable/user replaceable extensions. Not kernel-based.{{clarify|reason=How is the z/OS nucleus different from an OS kernel?|date=January 2016}}
Native APIs[14]: Filesystem access methods, Systems Services, etc.

Name: Name
File systems supported: File systems supported
